title.narrative: 2.3 IMPROVED EDUCATION SYSTEMS

description.narrative: 2.3 Improved governance, technical and managerial capacities of relevant education institutions to effectively deliver, monitor and report on Education services provided to the most marginalized, which contributes to Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Evaluation And Research, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2. By the end of 2022, the most disadvantaged children between 03-18 years of age benefit from equitable access to quality, relevant, and inclusive learning and early development.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.3 Improved governance, technical and managerial capacities of relevant education institutions to effectively deliver, monitor and report on Education services provided to the most marginalized

description.narrative: UNICEF provided support to the MoE and its institutions through direct deployments, capacity building interventions, and collecting evidence or knowledge generation to enhance the MoE's ability to use its systems for data collection, evidence-based programme planning, implementation support, and policy. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:17/01/2020

title.narrative: Policies institutionalized, studies and strategies implemented/published by the MEHE [previously Output Indicator 2.3.b: Appropriate national curricula, frameworks, standards, and policies reviewed and endorsed]

baseline.value: ALP and Prep-ECE programmes currently endorsed Existing teaching curriculum framework Uniform protocols and mechanisms to monitor child (and gender-based) violence do not exist

target.value: 2020:Policy documents on the institutionalization of TTCM are available / The inter-ministerial National Strategy on Child Marriage in Education is implemented / A national Strategy/Policy on Inclusive Education is validated by the MEHE/study on gender dimension is published/A baseline study on public school teachers in Lebanon is published

title.narrative: Thematic assessments and evaluations undertaken

baseline.value: Comprehensive data on OOSC in Lebanon unavailable Evaluation of UNICEF AWPs with MEHE as yet not undertaken Information on barriers to access and retention not comprehensively documented Lack of su

title.narrative: 2.3.5 - The RACE II MTR document, oriented towards Lebanon is completed and validated by the MEHE and REC

target.value: 2020:The RACE II MTR document, oriented towards Lebanon is completed and validated by the MEHE and REC

actual.value: 2020:The report is in the review phases

title.narrative: 2.3.6 - A community-centric school maintenance policy adopted and enforced by MEHE

target.value: 2020:A community-centric school maintenance policy adopted and enforced by MEHE

title.narrative: 2.3.1 - Policy documents on the institutionalization of TTCM are available [An inclusive TTCM approach to teacher training is institutionalized across in-service continuous learning (CERD)]

target.value: 2020:Policy documents on the institutionalization of TTCM are available

title.narrative: The content of the Remedial/Homework Support package is revised to cater for Lebanese and non-Lebanese children in basic education.
Technical Review of NFE packages conducted as applicable
Output Indicator 2.3.c: Technical Support is provided to the MEHE [Technical capacity of the MEHE and its institutions strengthened]

target.value: 2020:Technical Support is provided to the MEHE

title.narrative: Training modules are developed and tested by CERD
